titleStmt.title: Carmen expostulatorium: or, A timely expostulation vvith those both of the City of London, and the present armie, vvho have either endeavoured to ingage these kingdoms in a second warre; or neglected the prevention thereof. Intended, for averting (if it may be possible) of that generall destruction thereby threatened; and to that purpose, hastily (upon the immergent occasion) published. / By Geo. VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

titleStmt.title: Carmen expostulatorium: or, A timely expostulation vvith those both of the City of London, and the present armie, vvho have either endeavoured to ingage these kingdoms in a second warre; or neglected the prevention thereof. Intended, for averting (if it may be possible) of that generall destruction thereby threatened; and to that purpose, hastily (upon the immergent occasion) published. / By Geo. VVither.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

publicationStmt.date: Printed in the yeere M DC XLVII. [1647]

notesStmt.note: The roman numeral date in the imprint is made with turned c's.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
